description.narrative: The development objective of the Additional Financing for the Health Systems Strengthening Project for Uganda is to deliver the Uganda National Minimum Health Care Package (UNMHCP) to Ugandans, with a focus on maternal health, newborn care, and family planning. The additional credit will cover the funding shortfall for the renovation of the health facilities selected under the original project. It will ensure basic functionality of the facilities and scale up services for maternal care. With the adoption of output based aid financing approach, the project will promote results-based and demand-side financing in the sector, and contribute to improved utilization of safe delivery services in rural and underserved areas. The project restructuring involves: (a) revision of the project development objective (PDO) for improved clarity; (b) revising the results framework; (c) introducing output based aid financing under the improvement of maternal, neonatal, and family planning services component; and (d) extending the project closing date from July 31, 2015 to June 30, 2017.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Section I B 2 (a) | Description :The Recipient shall, not later than April 15 of each year during Projectimplementation, starting in calendar year 2011, furnish tothe Association for approval, an annual work plan and budget for the |Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Section I C 1 | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that the Project is carried out in accordance with theprovisions of the Anti-Corruption Guidelines. | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Section I C 2 | Description :Recipient shall carry out the Project in accordance with the Health GovernanceStrategy and Action Plan. | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Section I C 3 | Description :Recipient shall carry out, under terms of reference satisfactory to theAssociation, annual audits on procurement | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Section I D 1 | Description :The Recipient shall implement the Project in accordance with the provisions of theHealth Care Waste Management Plan and EMPs. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Section I D 2 | Description :Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Association not later than 45 days afterthe end of each calendar quarter, a report on the implementation of the Health Care Waste Management Plan and EMPs | Frequency:Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Section II A 1 | Description :The Recipient shall prepare and furnish the Association Project Reports coveringthe period of one calendar quarter not later than forty-five (45) days after the end of the period. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Section II B 2 | Description :The Recipient shall maintain a financial management system in accordance with theprovisions of Section 4.09 of the General Conditions. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Section II B 3 | Description :The Recipient shall submit audited Financial Statements for the project to theAssociation not later thansix months after the endof FY year. | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Section II B 4 (a) | Description :The Recipient shall undertake in-depth internal audit reviews twice a year. |Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Section II B 4 (b) | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that its auditor general conducts two value-for-money audits over the Project duration. | Frequency :Yearly

The Recipient shall appoint a Voucher Management Agency, in accordance with the provisions of Section III of this Schedule 2 and anIndependent Verification Evaluation Agency, in accordance with the provisions of Section III of this Schedule 2.

title.narrative: Health facilities constructed, renovated, and/or equipped (number)
People with access to a basic package of health, nutrition, or reproductive health services (number)
Hospitals with medical superintendents trained in health management/hospital administration
Health workers receiving a salary within two months from reporting to work
Hospitals and HC IVs offering comprehensive emergency obstetric care
Health facilities without stock-outs of tracer medicines and supplies
HC IV facilities conducting maternal and perinatal death audits
Pregnant women receiving antenatal care during a visit to a health provider (number)
Deliveries taking place in Government and PNFP Health Facilities (%)
Approved positions filled by qualified health workers
